content: The online gaming bill will help promote the country as a game manufacturer's destination while also discouraging online gambling, which has destroyed thousands of families, Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told NDTV today.

title: China In "Opportunistic" Move, Pounces On Cheap Russian Oil, As Indian Demand Dips
content: Chinese refineries have ramped up their crude oil purchases from Russia as demand from India has weakened. Trump has threatened to impose secondary tariffs on goods from countries importing Russian oil in to pressure Moscow to end the war in Ukraine.

content: India on Wednesday successfully test-fired intermediate range ballistic missile Agni 5 from the Integrated Test Range in Odisha's Chandipur, a defence statement said.

title: Foreign-Branded Phone Sales In China Dip 13.3% In June
content: Sales of foreign-branded phones, including Apple Inc.'s iPhone, declined 31.3% year-on-year in China in June.

title: Missing Friday Prayers May Lead To Fine, Jail For Muslim Men In This Malaysian State
content: Muslim men in Malaysia's Terengganu state may face up to two years in prison, a fine of 3,000 Malaysian Ringgit, or both if they skip Friday prayers without a valid reason.

content: Attack on CM Rekha GuptaÂ Live News: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was allegedly attacked during a "Jan Sunwai" programme on Thursday morning, police said, adding that the accused has been caught and is being questioned.

title: On Camera, Man Falls Into Drain As Cover Gives Way In Maharashtra
content: A man fell into a drain in Maharashtra's Chandrapur after the cover collapsed beneath him. A video of the incident showed the man alighting from a parked scooter near a bakery with boxes in his hand.

title: How Trump's Push For 'Americanism' At The Smithsonian Is Deeply Orwellian
content: President Donald Trump has revealed his ambitions to rewrite America's official history to, in the words of the Organisation of American Historians, "reflect a glorified narrative ... while suppressing the voices of historically excluded groups."

content: The young of today do not know the charm of the handwritten word. If it came in an envelope, then it could well be a 'rakhi' from a sister, a 'tika' from mother, a dried and pressed rose bud or, even better, the fragrance of the lipstick of a beloved

title: Fireball Lights Up Night Sky In Japan
content: A flashing fireball dashed across the skies of western Japan, shocking residents and dazzling stargazers, though experts said it was a natural phenomenon and not an alien invasion.

title: Man Who Attacked Rekha Gupta "Serial Offender", Charged Several Times: Cops
content: The man who was arrested for attacking Rekha Gupta during 'Jan Sunwai' at her camp office in Civil Lines here on Wednesday is a "serial offender" and several cases have been registered against him in Rajkot in Gujarat, officials said.

title: Elderly Man Killed After Argument Over Matchbox Escalates In UP: Cops
content: A man was fatally struck on the head with an iron rod after an argument over a matchbox escalated here during late night drinking between three people, police said on Wednesday.

title: How Mumbai Monorail Became A 'White Elephant'
content: Mumbai's monorail services restarted today after two trains broke down on Tuesday evening, leaving nearly 800 passengers stranded.

title: Why Putin Had To Pay Rs 2.2 Crore In Cash To Refuel Jet In Alaska
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin had to pay nearly $250,000 (about Rs 2.2 crore) in cash to refuel three jets while returning from the United States, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said.

title: 100-Foot Flagpole At Actor Vijay's Party Meet Venue Falls On Car
content: A 100-feet flagpole erected at the venue of August 21 Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party conference in Tamil Nadu's Madurai collapsed on a car, heavily damaging it.

title: Bill To Ban Online Games Played With Money Passed In Lok Sabha
content: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed a legislation to ban online games played with money as it looks to check rising instances of addiction, money laundering and financial fraud through such applications.

title: UK Bans Sanex Shower Gel Ad Over Racial Stereotyping
content: Britain's advertising regulator banned an advert for Sanex shower gel, owned by US consumer goods group Colgate-Palmolive, for suggesting black skin was "problematic" and white skin was "superior".

content: Says Rajiv Gandhi is an inspiration for the youth and stressed the need to reduce the minimum age to contest Assembly polls; states that Rahul Gandhi can only fulfil former PM Rajiv Gandhiâ€™s aspirations as Prime Minister of India

title: 'Misplaced': India rejects Yunus govt's 'anti-B'desh activities' claim
content: India has dismissed Bangladesh's interim government's concerns about anti-Bangladesh activities originating from Indian soil, asserting its policy against allowing political actions targeting other nations. The MEA spokesperson emphasised India's expectation for free and fair elections in Bangladesh. This response follows Bangladesh's army chief's offer to support the interim government in ensuring neutral elections amid shifts in the political landscape.

title: 'If West criticises â€¦': Russia slams Trump's 25% 'sanctions' on India
content: Russia has strongly condemned the US for pressuring India to halt Russian crude oil imports, deeming the tariffs 'unjustified' and 'unlawful.' Russian officials affirmed their commitment to uninterrupted oil supplies to India, highlighting a 'special mechanism'.

title: Foxconn shift: No longer Appleâ€™s iPhone factory floor; now building this AI technology
content: Foxconn, known for iPhone production, is changing its business. The company is now focusing on artificial intelligence. It is building AI servers for cloud computing and generative AI. Demand for AI infrastructure is increasing. Foxconn is partnering with Nvidia, Supermicro, and Dell. This move positions Foxconn as a key player in enterprise hardware.

title: 'Nation remembers': Shah slams oppn's uproar over new bills; cites Indira-era amendment
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticized the opposition for opposing bills aimed at removing ministers facing serious criminal charges. Shah highlighted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's commitment to fighting political corruption. He mentioned the introduction of a constitutional amendment to ensure ministers cannot govern from jail. The bills have been referred to a Joint Committee of Parliament.

title: Reprimand on debut: Big setback for South Africa! Bowler reported for suspect action
content: South Africa's ODI series against Australia began with a victory overshadowed by concerns regarding Prenelan Subrayen's bowling action. The off-spinner, making his debut, was reported for a suspect action and will undergo assessment. This setback impacted South Africa's team balance, especially with Kagiso Rabada's injury.

title: Microsoft workers occupy HQ: Protest Israel ties; biggest escalation yet
content: Microsoft employees protested at the company's headquarters in Redmond, demanding an end to its contracts with Israel. The group, "No Azure for Apartheid," renamed the plaza "Martyred Palestinian Children's Plaza" and erected memorials. They are urging Microsoft to divest from Israeli partnerships, alleging the Azure cloud platform aids the Israeli military and contributes to civilian deaths in Gaza.

title: 'I was in shock': Delhi CM Rekha Gupta's first reaction after attack
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta was attacked during a public hearing. She addressed the incident on X, vowing to continue serving the public. The accused, Sakariya Rajeshbhai Khimjibhai, has been arrested. He has a criminal record. Police are investigating the incident as a planned conspiracy. Security measures for CM Gupta may be reviewed.

title: â€˜Rockets to Wall Streetâ€™: Muskâ€™s teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: 'Going back to medieval times': Rahul slams new bills tabled in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the Centre's new bills proposing the removal of elected officials facing serious criminal charges, likening it to medieval times. He questioned the sudden resignation and silence of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar. Gandhi also voiced support for INDIA blocâ€™s Vice-Presidential candidate, Sudershan Reddy, expressing confidence in his strong campaign.

title: Maharashtra poll row: FIR against psephologist Sanjay Kumar; accused of 'spreading false info'
content: Sanjay Kumar, a psephologist with Lokniti-CSDS, faces legal trouble in Nagpur, Maharashtra, after an FIR was filed against him for allegedly spreading false information related to the assembly elections. The complaint cites multiple sections of the BNS following controversial social media posts.

title: 'I've settled six wars': Trump calls Netanyahu 'war hero'; says he is one too
content: Donald Trump praised Benjamin Netanyahu for ordering strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Trump called Netanyahu a war hero. He also suggested he deserved the same title. These comments followed Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. The US also deployed bombs against Iran's Fordo facility. Trump claimed to have eased tensions in several global conflicts.

title: Pro-American ideologies pre-requisite for visa, green card? What US agency said
content: Amidst growing concerns, the Trump administration's social media vetting and 'America First' policy are sparking division. Oklahoma plans to screen teachers from liberal states for 'woke' views. Trump criticized museums, including the Smithsonian and the National Museum of African American History and Culture, for focusing on negativity and slavery.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: Has Sachinâ€™s son shared anything on Instagram?
content: Arjun Tendulkar is reportedly engaged to Saaniya Chandok, though the Tendulkar family has not officially confirmed the news. The intimate ceremony was family-oriented, connecting the Tendulkar and Chandok families. Arjun, who plays for Mumbai Indians and represents Goa in domestic cricket, balances his personal milestone with his developing cricketing career.

title: French streamer Jean Pormanove dies at 46, fans outraged
content: French streamer Jean Pormanove, known for his extreme IRL broadcasts, tragically died at 46, sparking grief and outrage. His death followed a grueling Kick marathon, raising concerns about unsafe streaming culture. Fans are sharing disturbing clips, igniting debate on platform accountability and creator safety in the face of toxic content.

title: Chahal vs Dhanashree | 'Million feelings ...': Spinner posts a four-word cryptic message
content: Following Dhanashree Verma's emotional revelations about their divorce and criticism of Yuzvendra Chahal's attire during the court hearing, the cricketer has responded with a cryptic Instagram post. Chahal shared pictures of himself with the caption "Million feelings, Zero words," adding another layer to the public saga. Dhanashree's podcast comments and Chahal's reaction have ignited a social media storm.

title: From Murugadoss being slammed to Alia's anti-drug video- Here's top 5 ent news
content: The entertainment industry is currently filled with news. Salman Khan's fans criticized A R Murugadoss for lateness remarks. Alia Bhatt's anti-drug video faced backlash, leading to comment section shutdown. Faissal Khan wants Aamir Khan to take a DNA test. Joseph Radhik shared his favorite photo from Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's wedding. Swara Bhasker's sexuality remarks have sparked controversy online.

title: Stairway to heaven? The real reason Trump wants peace in Ukraine
content: President Trump, twice impeached, once convicted, and forever a master of spectacle, wants to end the war in Ukraine because he wants to go to heaven."I want to try and get to heaven, if possible," he said on live television. "I'm hearing I'm not doing well. I'm really at the bottom of the totem pole."With that, the most powerful man on Earth confessed that even he was afraid of the next world. Trump was not playing 4D chess. He was bargaining with God.â€‹

title: Lok Sabha ruckus: TMC MP says BJP's Bittu, Rijiju 'attacked, pushed' her
content: Amidst uproar in Lok Sabha over three contentious bills introduced by Amit Shah, Trinamool Congress (TMC) alleged that Union Ministers Ravneet Singh Bittu and Kiren Rijiju assaulted their female MPs. TMC MPs Mitali Bagh and Kalyan Banerjee claimed the ministers physically attacked and pushed them during the protest.

title: 'I resigned before...': Amit Shah hits back at Venugopal's 'morality' attack
content: Amit Shah addressed past accusations in Parliament. This happened during a discussion about new bills. Congress leader KC Venugopal questioned Shah's 2010 arrest. Shah stated he resigned before his arrest. He cited moral responsibility. Shah also mentioned his subsequent acquittal. The bills propose changes related to corruption charges against public officials and amendments to existing laws.

title: Online Gaming Bill 2025 passed in LS: Ban on real money gaming; boost for esports
content: Lok Sabha passed the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, amidst opposition protests. The bill aims to regulate online gaming, delighting esports but alarming real money gaming platforms. It proposes a central regulatory body, potentially impacting cricket sponsorships and endorsements. Esports anticipates a boost, gaining legitimacy as it prepares for its Olympic debut in 2027.

title: 'Naidu, Nitish most fearful': Raut's big claim on govt's 'removing PM, CMs' bill
content: Sanjay Raut claims the Centre introduced new bills to deter Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu from withdrawing support to the NDA government, fearing their opposition to provisions allowing the removal of leaders arrested for serious crimes.

title: Rankings: 35-yr-old South African at No 1; 2 Indians in Top 10, Namibia spinner makes in Top 5
content: Keshav Maharaj has regained the top spot in the ICC ODI bowling rankings, surpassing Kuldeep Yadav, who now ranks third. Namibia's Bernard Scholtz made a significant leap to fourth, marking a milestone for Associate cricket. Shubman Gill remains the top ODI batter, while India's Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma lead the T20I batting rankings, showcasing India's dominance in both formats.

title: Attack on Delhi CM: Attempt to murder case filed; accused caught on cam
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was attacked during a Jan Sunvai, prompting immediate police action and a medical examination for Gupta. The assailant, identified as Rajesh Khimji, had previously been seen surveilling Gupta's residence. While the accused is in custody and his background is being verified, Gupta's condition is stable, and she intends to continue her scheduled programs.

title: Infosys hands out higher bonus! Employees get average 80% payout
content: Infosys has distributed performance bonuses for the April-June quarter to eligible employees, with payouts averaging 80% and ranging from 75-89%. This marks an improvement compared to the previous quarter's disbursement.

title: Want to live longer? Research says THIS simple habit adds years to life
content: At 100 years old, Ruth exemplifies the benefits of exercise in old age, routinely walking four miles daily. Her dedication, along with a healthy diet and ample sleep, inspires others to prioritize their well-being. Research supports her lifestyle, highlighting walking's role in preventing age-related diseases and promoting overall health, proving it's never too late to start.

title: Asia Cup | 'Seems strange': Ex-India batter slams Shreyas Iyerâ€™s exclusion
content: Robin Uthappa has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's omission from India's Asia Cup squad, despite Iyer's strong performances, including being the leading run-scorer in the Champions Trophy and guiding his IPL teams to successive finals. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar defended the decision, citing squad size limitations.

title: Stephen A. Smith defends Trump; points to Biden for Ukraine-Russia conflict
content: Stephen A. Smith, on his podcast, defended Donald Trump, asserting he didn't initiate the Russia-Ukraine war. Smith argued that Joe Biden, as president during the full-scale conflict, bears responsibility. He further contended that decisions by Barack Obama, regarding Crimea, and Bill Clinton, concerning Ukraine's nuclear disarmament, contributed to the current crisis, emphasizing the importance of upholding promises to Ukraine.

title: Spying for Pakistan: Man detained in Jaisalmer; 4th case from district
content: In Jaisalmer, a 30-year-old man named Jivan Khan has been detained on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. Military Intelligence apprehended Khan, who previously worked at a restaurant within the military area, after he attempted to enter an Army station. Questioning revealed he has relatives in Pakistan.

title: Cricketer penalised for obscenity: Australia spinner reprimanded by ICC - see details
content: Australian leg-spinner Adam Zampa has been reprimanded by the ICC for using inappropriate language during the first ODI against South Africa. Zampa admitted to the offense, which occurred after a misfield. He received one demerit point. South Africa won the match by 98 runs, with Keshav Maharaj taking five wickets.

title: 'If Indian goods can't go to US, they can ...': Russia slams Trump tariffs; calls pressure over oil 'unjustified'
content: Prime Minister Modi and Russian President Putin are scheduled to meet in New Delhi to bolster trade ties, focusing on improved payment systems and the removal of trade barriers. Russia aims to strengthen its economic partnership with India amidst global challenges.

title: Chess | Drama! Dutch No 1 Anish Giri blocks Carlsen's long-time coach on social media
content: A social media clash erupted between Anish Giri and Peter Heine Nielsen after Giri commented on D Gukesh's drawing tendencies. Nielsen criticised Giri's view on player mentality, sparking a heated exchange where Giri referenced Carlsen's playing style and Nielsen's alleged bias. Despite the feud, Giri remains in strong form, recently finishing as runner-up in the Chennai Grand Masters 2025.

title: 'War 2' box office collection day 7: Film to cross Rs 200 crore in India
content: Released on August 14th amidst a box office clash with 'Coolie,' 'War 2' initially lagged behind, earning Rs 51.5 crore on its opening day compared to 'Coolie's' Rs 65 crore. Despite decent weekend numbers, 'War 2' experienced a significant drop on Monday, its fifth day.

title: Cricket | Kohli, Rohit disappear from latest ODI rankings. What happened?
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli had curiously dropped out of the latest ICC ODI rankings, with Shubman Gill in the lead among Indian batters. According to ICC rules, players are removed from rankings if they haven't played within a qualifying period, which is 9-12 months for ODIs.

title: 'Moment of pride': Shah approves name change; Jalalabad to be now called ...
content: The Union Home Minister, Amit Shah, has approved the renaming of Jalalabad in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur district to Parshurampuri. This decision follows a letter sent to the state's Chief Secretary, indicating the central government's approval.

title: Kambli health update | 'He needs your love and support': Brother hopeful of recovery
content: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is facing health challenges, battling a urinary infection and speech difficulties. His brother, Virendra, shared an emotional update, revealing Kambli's slow recovery and ongoing treatment after a recent hospital stay. Despite financial struggles and personal challenges, Kambli's family remains his strongest support.

title: Upset over SC order on stray dogs? Man who 'attacked' Delhi CM did 'recce'; how incident unfolded
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was allegedly attacked during her Jan Sunwai, causing chaos. A man, identified as Rajesh Bhai Khimji Bhai Sakriya, reportedly grabbed her hand, prompting immediate intervention by attendees and security. Virendra Sachdeva, Delhi BJP president, called it a security breach. Gupta, though in shock, is stable and committed to her work.

title: 'Bill to remove PM, CMs': Tharoor breaks from party line; calls proposal 'reasonable'
content: Shashi Tharoor supports the new bills regarding ministers' removal upon imprisonment. The bills propose removing ministers jailed for 30 days on serious charges. This stance differs from other Congress leaders like Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who criticizes the bill. She calls it draconian and anti-democratic. The proposed law mandates resignation for PMs, CMs, and ministers detained for offenses with five-year sentences.

title: Over 7.6 lakh Indians went abroad in 2024: STEM courses lead
content: Over 7.6 lakh Indian students pursued global education in 2024, marking a slight decrease from 2023's 8.95 lakh. The US, Canada, and the UK remain top destinations, while Germany and Russia gain traction. STEM, AI, and business courses are highly sought after. Government initiatives like MRQs and the ICWF support students, but visa issues and rising costs pose challenges.

title: Historic! Praggnanandhaa becomes new World No 3 after beating Gukesh - who holds the top spots?
content: Indian chess player R Praggnanandhaa has achieved a milestone. He defeated D Gukesh at the Sinquefield Cup. Praggnanandhaa is now ranked World No. 3. He has a live rating of 2784.1 points. Only Magnus Carlsen and Hikaru Nakamura are ahead of him. Praggnanandhaa shares the tournament lead with Levon Aronian. The Sinquefield Cup has a prize pool of USD 350,000.

title: Titans' Sneed, out since early last season, off PUP

title: Top 10 NBA players at 2025 EuroBasket: Where Jokic and Doncic stack up abroad

title: NFC North preview: Who gets to double-digit wins? Trust Bears hype?
